title: Major ProSeminar
description: The class was dedicated to exploring technological trends, and figuring out how the education we are getting is going to meet the requirements of those trends.

projects.title: Introductory Quantum Computing Presentation
projects.description: One of the video created to effectively explain a selected topic.

title: Software Design
description: This is an intermediate-level programming course covering techniques for developing large-scale software systems using object-oriented programming. Coverage includes software development life cycle models, requirements analysis, and graphical user interface development.

projects.title: ChillJava
projects.description: My first Android application created for a final project. The application started as a Starbucks mock idea, which I implemented in concept, but would not work in practice.

title: Introduction to Computer Networks
description: Survey of Telecomm and Data Comm Technology Fundamentals, Local Area Network, Wide Area Network, Internet and internetworking protocols including TCP/IP, network security and performance, emerging industry trends such as voice over the network and high speed networking.

projects.title: Python UDP Pinger
projects.description: As a team and under coursework instructions, we implemented a UDP pinger with Python.

projects.title: TCP Chat
projects.description: As a team, we implemented a TCP chat, coded in Python, that can be ran in Mininet.

projects.title: TCP Chat, But Better
projects.description: A culmination of the class, where we applied both programming skills and conceptual knowledge to refine the TCP chat.

title: Operating Systems
description: CST 334 - Operating Systems taught about the use and design of modern operating systems, focusing on Linux.

projects.title: PA1
projects.description: Initial Programming Assignment to accustom oneself with C and running tests.

projects.title: PA2
projects.description: This Programming Assignment was done to get accustomed with scheduling algorithms such as FIFO, LIFO, Round Robin, SJF, and others.

projects.title: PA3
projects.description: Paging PA

projects.title: PA3
projects.description: Paging PA

projects.title: PA4
projects.description: Memory Management Unit, Virtual Memory paging system.

projects.title: PA5
projects.description: PA5 implements an in-memory database to track player statistics in a thread-safe manner.

title: Internet Programming
description: CST336 - Internet Programming taught full-stack development using technologies like NodeJS, HTML, and CSS. The class also introduced 3d-party API integration into development.

projects.title: Rick and Morty Infopage
projects.description: An Infopage for Rick and Morty show. Done as a practice in using the third-party APIs in personal projects. Allows for pagination, as well as lookup by name.

projects.title: VibeVault
projects.description: A group project for the class. Acts as a journalind application for vibes, encorporates GIF and quotes APIs.

title: Introduction to Database Systems
description: The class taught simple SQL database queries, RDBMS, database schemas, and backend implementation with SpringBoot.

projects.title: Lab19
projects.description: Lab 19 was part of the assignment where we were to design and implement a pharmaceutical prescription management system using MySQL and SpringBoot.

title: Introduction to Data Science
description: Introduction to Data Science taught advanced use cases for python data science libraries such as pandas and numpy. We had the opportunity to learn Machine Learning algorithms such as KNN, Linear Regression, Decision Trees, and more.

title: Digital Art and Design
description: CST 328 - Digital Art and Design taught the basics of color theory, the psychology behind colors, and what use cases would fit best for the type of service. Practiced applying the skills with tools like Figma, Unity, and Photoshop.

description: Design and Analysis of Algorithms taught common algorithms needed to successfully tackle most Leetcode-like programmatic problems.

title: Software Engineering
description: CST 438 - Software Engineering involved learning about best software engineering practices as well as practicing the learned paradigms in an applied setting.
